meanings.definition: A defense of God's goodness and omnipotence in view of the existence of evil.
meanings.sent1: The theodicy presented in the book helped explain why bad things happen.
meanings.sent2: Many philosophers have written about the theodicy of evil in the world.
meanings.sent3: The theodicy discussion at the dinner party turned into a lively debate.
meanings.sent4: Her belief in the theodicy of the universe gave her comfort during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The professor's explanation of the theodicy was clear and easy to understand.
